title_en: The Large Sutra Perfection of Wisdom
notes: Also known as the Mahāprajñāpāramitāsūtra, translation 660-663 (Lancaster, 2004, 'K 1')

summary: A sūtra in the prajñāpāramitā tradition.
A sūtra in the prajñāpāramitā tradition.

title_en: The Perfection of Wisdom in 25,000 Lines
summary: This sūtra, is one of the three key large prajñāpāramitāsūtras. The other two are the Aṣṭasāhasrikāprajñāpāramitāsūtra or or Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines 小品般若波羅蜜經, and The Large Sūtra Perfection of Wisdom 大般若波羅蜜多經 (Buswell and Lopez, 2014, 'Pañcaviṃśatisāhasrikāprajñāpāramitāsūtra').

This is first translation of the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines or the Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā into Chinese by Lokakṣema in 179. (Conze, 1973, p. xi; Lancaster, 2004, 'K 6') This sūtra is thought to be the earliest Prajñāpāramitāsūtra and Mahāyāna sūtra translated into Chinese (Lancaster, 1975; Buswell and Lopez, 2014, 'Aṣṭasāhasrikāprajñāpāramitā').
notes: Based on the version in the Korean canon (Lancaster, 2004, 'K 6')

summary: This is second translation of the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines or the Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā into Chinese by Zhi Qian in 222-229. (Conze, 1973, p. xi; Lancaster, 1975).
This is third translation of the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines or the Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā into Chinese by Dharmapriya 曇摩蜱 and Fo Nian 竺佛念 in 382 (Lancaster, 1975).

title_en: Sutra of Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines
summary: This sūtra is a version of the Aṣṭasāhasrikāprajñāpāramitāsūtra or Aṣṭa for short, is thought to be the earliest prajñāpāramitāsūtra sūtra. (Buswell and Lopez, 2014, 'Aṣṭasāhasrikāprajñāpāramitā')
